I am a college student at MIT, in Cambridge MA, and I live in San Francisco. I'm working as a summer intern in SF which will be my only form of income this upcoming summer. Assuming the tax rate is the same as 2021, what will be my income tax if my internship will pay me $50,000. B. 6,383 C. 8,393 D. 9,882 A. 48,001. Respond with only the letter of the answer choice.

data.sampled:
Your income tax liability will be calculated using the following formula:

Tax liability = Income tax rate * Income

So, to calculate your tax liability, we need to know the income tax rate for 2021. The current income tax rate for individuals is 10% and the rate for corporations is 21% (the highest possible rate).

Based on these rates and your income of $75,000, your tax liability will be:

Tax liability = $75,000 * 10% * 21% = $2,700

Therefore, option D is the best option for you, as it gives you the least amount of tax liability.

If your internship pays you $50,000, your income tax will depend on your tax rate and other factors. Under the Federal Income Tax Act (FITA), the following tax brackets apply to your income:

0 to $9,000: 10% tax rate
9,001 to $36,000: 15% tax rate
36,001 to $89,000: 25% tax rate

To calculate your tax liability, you'll need to determine your total income, including your internship pay, minus any tax exemptions or deductions you may be entitled to. Once you have all of your pertinent information, you can use the Interactive Tax Calculator at Internal Revenue Service.gov to calculate your tax liability.

The tax amount you select on the Interactive Tax Calculator will be based on your specific tax situation, so it's a good idea to review its input fields and tax tables before making a selection. Your income tax would be calculated using the progressive income tax rate schedule in place in 2021. The applicable tax rate for your income, which includes your summer internship salary, would be determined by the amount of income you earn above the standard deduction.

As a student at MIT, you are subject to a unique tax bracket structure that depends on your age and filing status. In 2021, you would fall into the 24% tax bracket for earned income up to $127,600, and the 36% tax bracket for earned income above that amount.

Based on your information, your internship salary would be taxed at a rate of 25% for the first $37,800 of income, and 28% for the portion of income that exceeds $37,800. Your total tax liability would therefore be calculated as follows:
